summary: This is a service request ticket from SigNet Technologies for the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The request is to rebuild a RAID array on a surveillance system (VISION product type). The ticket includes email correspondence between support technicians regarding the technical procedure.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E. Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The service request is for the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, located at 150 Park Row, New York, NY.
The issue involves rebuilding a RAID array on a VISION product type surveillance system, indicating potential data storage or system failure.
The request was marked as a priority and an emergency, requiring phone support and was completed between February 28 and March 20, 2019.
Technical instructions for the RAID rebuild were provided via email from Qognify support engineer Derek Barr to SigNet technician Jeffrey McKenzie.
The document is a routine technical support ticket, not directly related to Epstein case events, but shows operational details of MCC New York's infrastructure.
